dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: This species was collected in hill-streams strongly shaded by forest; mostly found in shallow water close to the shores between roots, plants or leaf litter.  Some specimens were also collected from the swift flowing area between boulders.  Water data from the type locality:   colourless, clear and with a pH of 6.2, an electric conductivity of 20-40 µS/cm and a  temperature of 24-26 °C (Ref. 78499).

dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Allen, D. 2013. Betta apollon. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description: The species is only known from hill streams west of Narathiwat in peninsular Thailand (Schindler and Schmidt 2006).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Hill streams west of Narathiwat, peninsular Thailand.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Morphology
dataObjects.description: Dorsal spines (total): 1; Dorsal soft rays (total): 8 - 9; Anal spines: 2 - 3; Analsoft rays: 23 - 24

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.description: This species belonging to the Betta pugnax group is differentiated from the others by having the following characters:  elongated last branchiostegal ray extending beyondposterior margin of the operculum; 25-26 total anal-fin rays; 29-30 lateral scales (Ref. 78499).

dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
DD
Data Deficient

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2013

Assessor/s
Allen, D.

Reviewer/s
Vidthayanon, C. & Smith, K.

Contributor/s

Justification
The species is currently known from hill streams west of Narathiwat in peninsular Thailand. Whilst the species is likely to be impacted if shown to be a valid and restricted species, further work is required to confirm this, and it is considered Data Deficient at present.
